alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 11:27PM PST until December 07 at 4:41AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain over the Central Washington Cascades has come to an end Tuesday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River near Monroe. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the Snohomish River will flood several roads and much of the low pasture land in the river valley. A stage of 16 feet at this location corresponds to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to crest around 16.5 feet early Wednesday morning. The river will begin receding late Wednesday morning and fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 730 AM PST.
